item.title: 水曜日に新しい3年契約の交渉のためにスタジオ幹部と会う予定のSAG-AFTRAは、AI「デジタルダブル」の使用をカバーする契約を求めている（Christopher Grimes/Financial Times）。
item.description:
Christopher Grimes / Financial Times:
SAG-AFTRA, which plans to meet studio executives on Wednesday to negotiate a new three-year contract, seeks a deal that covers the use of AI “digital doubles”  —  Unions fear artificial intelligence could cause artists to lose control of their image while making writers obsolete

item.title: Spotify、ポッドキャスト部門でスタッフの2%にあたる〜200人の人員削減を計画、ParcastとGimletをSpotify Studiosに統合、100M以上のポッドキャストリスナーを報告（Sahar Elhabashi/Spotify）
item.description:
Sahar Elhabashi / Spotify:
Spotify plans to cut ~200 jobs, or 2% of its staff, at its podcast unit, combines Parcast and Gimlet into Spotify Studios, and reports 100M+ podcast listeners  —  Below is an adaptation of an internal update on Spotify's Podcast Business from Sahar Elhabashi, VP, Head of Podcast Business.

item.title: 内部資料です：Twitterの4月1日から5月開始までの米国での広告収入は前年同期比59%減の$88M、情報筋によれば、業績はすぐに改善しそうにないとのこと（New York Times)
item.description:
New York Times:
Internal document: Twitter's US ad revenue from April 1 to the start of May dropped 59% YoY to $88M; sources say that performance is unlikely to improve soon  —  In internal forecasts, the company projected that ad sales would keep declining, handing a tough challenge to its new chief executive.

item.title: ViaplayのCEO、Anders Jensen氏が5年ぶりに退任、景気悪化による加入者離れと広告市場の悪化、第2四半期の広告売上は12％～16％減少か（Max Goldbart/Deadline）
item.description:
Max Goldbart / Deadline:
Viaplay CEO Anders Jensen steps down after five years, as an economic downturn causes subscriber churn and ad market deterioration; Q2 ad sales may drop 12%-16%  —  Viaplay Group CEO Anders Jensen is stepping down immediately amidst an economic downturn that is causing rapid deterioration in the ad market and subscriber churn.

item.title: 香港の最高裁判所が、2019年の暴徒襲撃事件に対する警察の対応を調査したジャーナリスト、バオ・チョイの有罪判決を覆し、報道の自由にとって珍しい勝利となった（Kari Soo Lindberg/Bloomberg)
item.description:
Kari Soo Lindberg / Bloomberg:
Hong Kong's top court overturns the conviction of Bao Choy, a journalist who investigated the police response to a 2019 mob attack, a rare win for press freedom  —  Hong Kong's top court overturned the conviction of a journalist who investigated the police response to a 2019 mob attack …

item.title: WaymarkがDALL-E 2を使って作成した12分のムービー「The Frost」の様子、WaymarkやRunwayなどのスタートアップが高速かつ安価な映像制作のためのAIツールを作る（Will Douglas Heaven/MIT Technology Review）
item.description:
Will Douglas Heaven / MIT Technology Review:
A look at The Frost, a 12-minute movie created by Waymark using DALL-E 2, as startups like Waymark and Runway make AI tools for fast and cheap video production  —  Exclusive: Watch the world premiere of the AI-generated short film The Frost.  —  The Frost nails its uncanny, disconcerting vibe in its first few shots.

item.title: テッド・コッペル氏とのQ&A、より客観的な情報を引き出そうとした方法、厳しいインタビュアーとしての評判、ヘンリー・キッシンジャーとの友情について（Isaac Chotiner/New Yorker)
item.description:
Isaac Chotiner / New Yorker:
Q&A with Ted Koppel on how he tried to extract more objective information, having a reputation as a tough interviewer, and his friendship with Henry Kissinger  —  Did the veteran newscaster give Kissinger a pass on his hundredth birthday?  —  For a quarter century, Ted Koppel hosted …

item.title: イリヤ・ポージンのTellyによる広告サポート付き無料デュアルスクリーンテレビの様子。同社のデータおよび分析ツールは、他のテレビベンダーよりも侵略的なものではないという。（Chris Welch/The Verge）
item.description:
Chris Welch / The Verge:
A look at the ad-supported, free dual-screen TV from Ilya Pozin's Telly, which says its data and analytics tools will be no more invasive than other TV vendors  —  More than 250,000 people have signed up in hopes of getting Telly's unique TV.  There's something to this concept, but plenty of unknowns remain.

item.title: CNNの40人以上のスタッフが、クリス・リヒトの残酷なプロフィールとデイヴィッド・リーヴィのCOO就任の発表を受けて、怒りと恐怖を共有。リヒトは信頼を取り戻すことを誓う（Brian Stelter/New York Magazine）
item.description:
Brian Stelter / New York Magazine:
Over 40 CNN staffers share their anger and fear after a brutal profile of Chris Licht and the announcement of David Leavy as COO; Licht vows to earn back trust  —  Staffers' confidence is shaken, but the CEO is vowing to “fight like hell to win back their trust.”

item.title: Showtimeは、Viceの第4シーズンから、グアンタナモ湾での米海軍弁護士時代のRon DeSantisを描いたエピソードを静かに取りやめ、5月28日に予定していた（Rick Porter/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Rick Porter / The Hollywood Reporter:
Showtime quietly pulled an episode about Ron DeSantis' time as a US Navy lawyer at Guantanamo Bay from Vice's fourth season; the episode was planned for May 28  —  An installment delving into the Florida governor and Republican presidential candidate's time as a U.S. Navy JAG officer …

item.title: ロシアの侵攻を取材したNYTなどのジャーナリストは、ウクライナの規則を破ったことで脅迫されたり、資格を剥奪されたり、拒否されたりした（Ben Smith/Semafor）
item.description:
Ben Smith / Semafor:
Journalists at the NYT and other outlets covering Russia's invasion have had their credentials threatened, revoked, or denied by Ukraine over breaking its rules  —  The News  —  Journalists covering the Russian invasion of Ukraine are engaged in a running, low-grade conflict with the Ukrainian government …

item.title: メディア学者のイーサン・ザッカーマンが、Twitterが事実上のデジタル公共広場になった理由、注目の政治、連盟の力などについて語ったQ&A(Wired)
item.description:
Wired:
Q&A with media scholar Ethan Zuckerman about why Twitter became the de facto digital public square, the politics of attention, the power of federation, and more  —  We talk to media scholar Ethan Zuckerman about why Twitter became the de facto digital public square and what other platforms like Bluesky or Mastodon might offer.

item.title: 情報筋の話：ジェフ・ザッカーのCNNとクリス・リヒトに対する不満はより頻繁になり、ザッカーは現・元スタッフの苦情のスイッチボードとして機能している（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Sources: Jeff Zucker's gripes about CNN and Chris Licht have become more frequent and Zucker is serving as a grievance switchboard for current and former staff  —  It's been more than a year since he was forced from the top job at the network.  Since then, he has made no secret of his frustrations …

item.title: DGAとスタジオが新労働契約の暫定合意に達し、賃金、ストリーミング残留物、安全、創作権、多様性、AI保護をカバー（Jeremy Fuster/The Wrap）
item.description:
Jeremy Fuster / The Wrap:
The DGA and studios reach a tentative deal on a new labor contract, covering wages, streaming residuals, safety, creative rights, diversity, and AI protections  —  The new deal also covers wage increases, creative rights and AI protections  —  The Directors Guild of America and the Alliance …

item.title: NBCのMeet the Pressの司会者Chuck Toddが9年ぶりに退任し、NBCホワイトハウス特派員Kristen Welkerが後を継ぐと語った（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
NBC's Meet the Press moderator Chuck Todd says he is stepping down after nine years and would be succeeded by NBC White House Correspondent Kristen Welker  —  He will be succeeded by Kristen Welker, NBC's chief White House correspondent and the co-anchor of “Weekend Today.”
